description:
At Kaimei High School, the Living Assistance Club (aka the Sket Brigade) was organized to help students with problems big or small. Most of the time, though, they hang out in their club room, bored, with only a few trivial problems floating in every once in a while. In spite of this, they still throw all their energy into solving these worries.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Band
tags.description: Main cast is a group of musicians.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

A Japanese voice actor, stage actor, narrator and singer affiliated with talent agency [Atomic Monkey](http://www.atomicmonkey.jp/jp/), having previously worked under [Haikyou](https://haikyo.co.jp/). He's also a chair member of creative production team HeroQ, which he joined in 1994.

[Profile](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=252) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/tokyojyanken/)

[Profile](https://sigma7.co.jp/actors/yoshino_hiroyuki) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_yocchin_______) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/_yocchin_______/)

It was announced on the day of Kiramune's 5th Anniversary that he will be the 7th member, and his debut will be August 28, 2013.

[Website](https://gackt.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/GACKT) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/gackt/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/GACKTofficial)

On Sep 7, 2021, he announced he is going on an indefinite hiatus from entertainment and performance activities due to an early onset neurological disease that at one point was a "life-threatening condition." His condition has since stabilized, but he remains on hiatus to focus on recovery. On May 17th 2022 it was announced that Gackt was yet to fully recover, but would resume activity by the end of the year.

He is the voice provider of the vocaloid [Gakupo Kamui](https://anilist.co/character/22085/Gakupo-Kamui)

**the pillows** were a Japanese alternative rock band, best known internationally for the soundtrack of the anime series FLCL. the pillows were originally "Coin Locker Babies" but was changed after Kenji left the band (KENZI&THE TRIPS).

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mill_sister)** | **[Website (blog)](https://blog.goo.ne.jp/gooussy)**

Kiyoko Sayama is a Japanese director, episode director, animation director and storyboard artist.

Married to [Tetsuya Kumagai](https://anilist.co/staff/101548/Tetsuya-Kumagai).
Known to be a fast and efficient worker. Often directing multiple works at a time.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/235154812) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/30949)

Started out as amateur gif animator before turning professional. He initially failed an examination test for [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) but was later scouted by the late [Osamu Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100406/) for [Beck](https://anilist.co/anime/57/). There he met noted animators [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/) and [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/), the former which he would work with on numerous occasions afterwards.

His breakthrough as an animator was on [Noein](https://anilist.co/anime/584/), a series directed by [Kazuki Akane](https://anilist.co/staff/102416/). The 12th episode was highly regarded by animation fans and other animators for the given display by him and Matsumoto. He would later also serve as a character designer on [Birdy the Mighty: Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/), another series directed by Akane.

His dedication for animation could also be seen on [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/), for which he animated a minute-long scene of the main character running down a street. He went on the actual street in Tokyo to film himself for reference footage for the cut.

node.description:
**Height:** 153 cm (5'0)

__[Profile (Osawa)](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/kayanoai/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kayanoai_0913) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kayanoai_0913/) | [YouTube Channel Official Twitter](https://twitter.com/_kayanomi) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0D6qi-Gr5RW7hqOvTEKmAw)__

__Introduction:__
Ai Kayano is a Japanese voice actress and vocalist currently affiliated with Office Osawa.

__Biography:__
Kayano wanted to work in a job that would involve "healing people", leading to initially take up a course at a vocational school. She worked in the beauty industry and became interested in acting after having seen [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477/). While attending school, Kayano continued working in the industry and paid for her tuition.

Kayano began working at Pro-Fit in 2010, voicing two supporting characters in the original video animation [Princess Resurrection](https://anilist.co/anime/9159/). In 2011, she voiced [Meiko "Menma" Honma](https://anilist.co/character/40592/) in [Anohana](https://anilist.co/anime/9989/) and received the Best Rookie Actress award for said role at the 6th Seiyuu Awards. Kayano, [Haruka Tomatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/95890/) and [Saori Hayami](https://anilist.co/staff/95869/) performed the series' ending theme "Secret Base – Kimi ga Kureta Mono (10 years after Ver.)", a cover of a song originally sung by the band Zone.

She is often praised for her vocal range, having voiced a variety of characters such as [Mayaka Ibara](https://anilist.co/character/55137/), [Mashiro Shiina](https://anilist.co/character/61371/), [Darkness](https://anilist.co/character/89363/) and [Akari Kawamoto](https://anilist.co/character/24311/) for example, none of which one would connect to the same voice actress.

**Trivia:**
- Worked part-time at a coffee shop with [Chinatsu Akasaki](https://anilist.co/staff/107652/) before becoming a voice actress.
- She got around 100 suggestions for her nickname in the Anohana radio show, from which she herself picked out Kayanon.

Non-anime roles:
- Atago - Azur Lane
- Graf Zeppelin - Azur Lane
- Kaga - Azur Lane
- Renown - Azur Lane
- Y'shtola Rhul - Final Fantasy XIV
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/猪爪慎一)
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/猪爪慎一)

French Kiss (フレンチ・キス) is a Japanese pop trio, and a sub-unit of AKB48, and was announced June 28, 2010.  The members are as follows: * Kashiwagi Yuki (柏木由紀) * Takajo Aki (高城亜樹) * Kuramochi Asuka (倉持明日香)  The group debuted with the single Zutto Mae Kara (ずっと前から) on September 8, 2010, and the lead song was used as the sixth ending theme song for the anime series “Major.”

node.description:
**Height**: 171 cm (5'7")

Hiroshi Tada is a member of [The Sketchbook](https://anilist.co/staff/108735/The-Sketchbook), a real-life band formed as a result of The Sketchbook Project, inspired by the anime and manga series Sket Dance. Tada was used as Bossun's singing voice in the anime, performing the songs 'Funny Bunny' and 'Michi'.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/231414719)

Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/)'s photography department.

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).

Vocal: Himura Tsuyoshi (緋村剛) 
Guitar & Programing: [tatsuo](https://anilist.co/staff/356832) (Real Name: Kinno Tatsuo, 金納たつお) 
Bass: Nagano Tenji (長野典二) 
Drums: Kondou Ayato (近藤彩人)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/325492584) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=tatsuya_yoshihara)

Freelance animator formerly affiliated with [Actas](https://anilist.co/studio/60/) where he was attending its internal animation school and debuted as animator at the age of 20. His work has been greatly influenced by contemporary Kanada school animators [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/) and [Hironori Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103979/). 

He's a precocious talent, debuting as episode director at the age of 21 and as director at the age of 23 with [Arve Rezzle](https://anilist.co/anime/13863/), as part of the Young Animator Training Project.

Married to fellow animator [Kikuko Sadakata](https://anilist.co/staff/105769).
